item.description:
It was the best of times, it was the worst of times,
there was snow on the ground, well... there was snow on the ground.

SO:
It was the age of wisdom, it was the age of foolishness,
we decided to play in the snow, we decided to get very wet,
it was the epoch of belief, it was the epoch of incredulity,
we will show up at seven, we will show up no later than seven thirty post meridiem,
it was the season of Light, it was the season of Darkness,
we will trudge through the snow merrily, we will eventually grow too haggard,
it was the spring of hope, it was the winter of despair,
we will go to UNO's or Charlie's or elsewhere for warmth and redemption, we will go home to our loved ones. (yes, this is a negative.)

Nota Bene: Same deal as usual folks. I have traveled near and far to the great Cambridge Common and have deemed the field "playable." Bring warmth and clothing. Newcomers and friends are heartily welcomed. Smile.

Your Swedish meatball,
Chris

781 301 1791
Call me if you have any doubts that we are playing due to the snow/wind/other minor gripes. Do note that I will respond with "yes, yes, yes we are playing, yes, oh my!"

Call Jim too, just for giggles. You can all make fun of his... hair? (617)-335-4191
item.why: Because we're really, really cool. And we look good. So good.
item.name: Snow-ee Frisbee on Cambridge Common (Quitters? Us? Never!)
